abstract.p: New York Islanders trade Chris Neilsen, center, to expansion Columbus Blue Jackets for their second- and ninth-round picks in this year's draft (S)

block.p: ISLANDERS TRADE NEILSEN: The Islanders yesterday traded Chris Neilsen, a center who was their second pick in the 1998 draft, to the expansion Columbus Blue Jackets for their second- and ninth-round picks in this year's draft.

Chris is a solid prospect, but it would have been a tough road for him here because we are well stocked with players who excel in a similar role, said Islanders General Manager Mike Milbury, referring to centers Claude Lapointe, Mats Lindgren and Tim Connolly, a second-year player.

ISLANDERS TRADE NEILSEN: The Islanders yesterday traded Chris Neilsen, a center who was their second pick in the 1998 draft, to the expansion Columbus Blue Jackets for their second- and ninth-round picks in this year's draft.

Chris is a solid prospect, but it would have been a tough road for him here because we are well stocked with players who excel in a similar role, said Islanders General Manager Mike Milbury, referring to centers Claude Lapointe, Mats Lindgren and Tim Connolly, a second-year player.
In 62 games with Calgary of the Western League, Neilsen, who was a second-round selection and the 36th pick over all, had 38 goals and 69 points.
